page.title: 13Customs
page.content:
Customs
Christians celebrate Christmas by exchanging presents, cards and money. Also people put up and decorate Christmas trees.Young children believe that Santa Claus delivers presents to them. At Easter people also exchange cards and give each other Easter Eggs. Chinese people have many customs. In the New Year children and unmarried people get a little red bag with money in from parents and relations. If somebody dies a special table with a picture of that person on it is set up. For the next few weeks, whenever the family eats, food is placed in front of the picture and they bow seven times in front of it. This is in remembrance of the person who has died.
